description:
Job Title: Business Development Consultant and Proposal Writer
Location: 100% Remote Work
Company: BizDev Experts
About Us:BizDev Experts is a leading consulting firm specializing in helping small businesses secure federal, state, and local government contracts. We are committed to delivering exceptional value to our clients and driving growth through strategic business development and proposal writing. Our team is dedicated to helping small businesses achieve success in the highly competitive government contracting arena, and we are seeking an experienced Business Development Consultant and Proposal Writer to join our dynamic team.
Position Overview:We are looking for a talented and results-driven Business Development Consultant and Proposal Writer with a minimum of 5 years of proven experience in government contracting. The ideal candidate is a self-starter, well-versed in federal, state, and local procurement processes, and capable of developing winning proposals that meet or exceed client expectations. While Shipley certification is considered ideal, it is not mandatory.
Responsibilities:

Conduct market research to identify government contracting opportunities at the federal, state, and local levels.
Develop and maintain relationships with government agencies, prime contractors, and potential teaming partners.
Collaborate with clients to understand their needs and goals, providing strategic advice on government contracting strategies.
Write, review, and edit comprehensive and compelling proposals, ensuring compliance with all RFP/RFQ requirements.
Manage the entire proposal development process, including proposal schedule, content, and coordination with subject matter experts.
Ensure proposals are submitted accurately and on time.
Monitor and analyze government procurement trends, regulations, and changes in the competitive landscape.
Continuously improve proposal development processes and templates.
Stay updated on industry best practices and innovations in government contracting.

Qualifications:

Minimum of 5 years of experience in government contracting, with a proven track record of winning contracts.
Strong knowledge of federal, state, and local procurement processes and regulations.
Exceptional writing, editing, and proofreading skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and proposal development tools.
Shipley certification (ideal, but not required).

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract, Temporary
Pay: $25.00 - $35.00 per hour
Expected hours: 10 – 30 per week
Benefits:

Flexible schedule

Schedule:

4 hour shift
8 hour shift
Monday to Friday

Travel requirement:

No travel

Application Question(s):

Are you open to part-time or freelance work?
What is your HOURLY pay requirement?
If hired, when is the soonest you can start working?

Work Location: Remote
